input: Create a pitch deck for Infinite Voyage targeting indie publishers. We need about 12-15 slides covering the game concept, gameplay, market positioning, team, and funding ask.
expected_behavior: Produces a slide-by-slide outline with title, content, speaker notes, and timing. Follows the hook → problem → vision → gameplay → market → team → ask structure. Includes backup slides.
rubric: 12-15 slides with clear structure
Strong opening hook
Market positioning with competitive analysis
Clear funding ask with budget breakdown
Speaker notes with timing included

description: Adapt a pitch for different audiences
input: I need to present Infinite Voyage to both a publisher and our development team. How should the pitch differ?
expected_behavior: Explains key differences in focus, language, and emphasis. Publisher pitch focuses on market, revenue, and ROI. Team pitch focuses on vision, technical approach, and milestones. Suggests specific slide changes.
rubric: Clear differentiation between audiences
Publisher focus: market, revenue, competitive advantage
Team focus: vision, technical approach, milestones
Specific slide modifications suggested
Tone differences explained

input: Create a competitive analysis for Infinite Voyage against similar games in the space exploration roguelike genre. Include 3-4 competitors.
expected_behavior: Produces a positioning matrix or comparison table showing Infinite Voyage's unique differentiators against 3-4 competitors. Highlights gaps in the market that Infinite Voyage fills.
rubric: 3-4 real competitors identified
Comparison uses relevant dimensions
Infinite Voyage's differentiators are clear
Market gap identified
Visual format suitable for slide presentation

description: Create an investor-focused pitch deck leading with financials and market sizing
input: Build an investor pitch deck for Infinite Voyage. We are raising a $2.5M seed round from game-focused VCs. Lead with the financial opportunity — TAM/SAM/SOM, ROI projections, and revenue model. Use the attached financial projections as source data. See evals/files/financial-projections.md for cost and revenue estimates.
expected_behavior: Produces a 10-12 slide investor deck that opens with the market opportunity and financial upside before presenting gameplay. Includes TAM/SAM/SOM breakdown, three-scenario ROI analysis, clear use-of-funds slide, and revenue model with platform splits. Positions the game as a financial opportunity, not just a creative one. Speaker notes translate game jargon into investor language.
rubric: TAM/SAM/SOM figures presented with credible sourcing
ROI analysis includes conservative, base, and optimistic scenarios
Use-of-funds slide with clear budget allocation breakdown
Revenue model accounts for platform fees, publisher splits, and DLC
Financial language appropriate for VC audience throughout speaker notes

description: Create an internal milestone review deck with KPIs, blockers, and next steps
input: Prepare a milestone review deck for our M3 (Vertical Slice) internal review with the publisher. We need to show what we planned vs what we delivered, key metrics from playtesting, current blockers, and our plan for M4. Use the milestone data in evals/files/milestone-data.md as the source.
expected_behavior: Produces an 8-10 slide milestone review deck following the planned-vs-actual structure. Opens with a milestone summary, then walks through deliverable status with clear on-track/at-risk/behind indicators. Presents playtest KPIs and technical metrics with targets vs actuals. Dedicates slides to blockers with proposed solutions and timelines. Closes with M4 targets and any resource requests. Tone is honest and professional, not defensive about missed targets.
rubric: Planned vs actual deliverables shown with clear status indicators
Playtest and technical KPIs presented with targets vs actuals
Blockers listed with specific proposed solutions and timelines
Budget status and any projected overspend disclosed transparently
Next milestone targets are concrete and measurable

description: Condense the full pitch into a 30-second verbal pitch and a 3-slide deck
input: I have a 30-second window with a publisher executive at GDC. Create a verbal elevator pitch script I can memorize, plus a 3-slide micro-deck I can show on my phone if they ask to see more. The game is Infinite Voyage — a narrative-driven space exploration RPG where you uncover ancient alien ruins across procedurally-assisted star systems.
expected_behavior: Produces a tightly written 30-second verbal pitch (roughly 75-80 words) that hooks with the unique selling proposition, conveys the core experience, names a comparable title for anchoring, and ends with a clear next-step ask. Also produces a 3-slide micro-deck: Slide 1 is a visual hook with tagline, Slide 2 is the core loop in 3 bullets with one key image, Slide 3 is the ask with contact info. Speaker notes explain delivery tips (pacing, eye contact, when to show the phone).
rubric: Verbal pitch is 75-85 words and deliverable in 30 seconds
Opens with a compelling hook, not the game title
Includes a comparable title anchor for instant context
3-slide deck is visually clean and readable on a phone screen
Ends with a specific call to action and next step

description: Prepare counter-arguments for common publisher objections
input: Our publisher pitch for Infinite Voyage is next week. Prepare counter-arguments and backup slide content for the 5 most common objections we expect to face. Use the anticipated objections listed in evals/files/publisher-objections.md as the basis. For each objection, I need a rebuttal strategy, a 1-2 sentence spoken response, and a backup slide outline I can jump to.
expected_behavior: Produces a structured objection-handling guide covering all 5 objections. Each entry includes: the objection paraphrased, the underlying concern it reveals, a rebuttal strategy explaining the approach, a concise spoken response (1-2 sentences suitable for live delivery), and a backup slide outline with title, key data points, and visuals. Rebuttals are evidence-based (citing market data, team credentials, comparable titles, and budget details) rather than dismissive.
rubric: All 5 objections addressed with distinct rebuttal strategies
Spoken responses are concise and confident, not defensive
Backup slides include specific data points and evidence
Underlying concerns behind each objection are identified
Rebuttals reference comparable titles, market data, or project specifics

description: Create a visual style guide brief for the pitch deck
input: Create a visual style guide for all Infinite Voyage pitch decks. Define the color palette, typography, image treatment, slide layout rules, and do/don't examples. Use our brand identity in evals/files/game-brand-colors.md as the foundation. This guide will be handed to a designer to produce final slides.
expected_behavior: Produces a comprehensive visual brief that a designer can follow without additional input. Specifies primary and secondary color palettes with hex codes and usage rules. Defines typography hierarchy with font families, weights, and sizes for each slide element. Includes slide layout templates (title slide, content slide, data slide, image slide) with spacing and alignment rules. Provides image treatment guidelines (style, mood, composition, color grading). Lists explicit do/don't examples for common mistakes. References the game's sci-fi aesthetic throughout.
rubric: Color palette specifies hex codes with clear usage rules for each color
Typography hierarchy covers titles, subtitles, body, and data labels
At least 3 slide layout templates with spacing and alignment guidance
Image treatment guidelines address style, mood, and composition
Do/don't examples cover at least 4 common presentation design mistakes
